googleSheetVaApiDataRow.earlyVotingNotes: Montana does not have early voting. However, state law provides in-person absentee voting 30 days before an election at the county election office.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Montana driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Enter your Montana driver’s license number or the last 4 digits of your social security number. If you don't have either number, please write “NONE” in this space.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules: Any registered Montana voter may request an absentee ballot and vote by mail.

googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: All Montana voters must show ID when voting.  You can show a non-expired photo ID issued by Montana or the Federal government, such as a driver's license, US passport, US military ID, or employee ID card issued by a state or federal agency.  If you don't have a photo ID, you can show a current utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, voter registration card, or any other government document that shows your name and Montana address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmWarnings: Your local election office will compare your signature on your voted ballot to the one on your driver’s license. If the signatures don't match, your ballot might be rejected. Please sign carefully.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.year2020LegalChanges: On August 6, the Governor of Montana issued an executive order allowing counties to conduct all mail ballot elections for the November 3, 2020 election. Please contact you local election official to know if you need to apply for an absentee ballot or if your county will mail you a ballot once you are registered.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: Montana does not require party registration to participate in any election.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Montana voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Montana you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be at least 18 years old on or before Election Day
  * be a resident of Montana and of the county in which you want to vote for at least 30 days before the next election
  * not be in a penal institution for a felony conviction
  * not currently be determined by a court to be of unsound mind
  * meet these qualifications by the next Election Day if you do not currently meet them
